snippet: Amid repeated Taliban attacks and a continuing war, Afghan presidential candidates step onto planes with guards carrying AK-47s, and rocket-propelled grenades are sometimes part of carry-on baggage.
abstract: Memo From Afghanistan; security concerns are no joking matter amid Taliban's threats to disrupt Afghanistan's presidential election, but the campaigns themselves have emerged largely unscathed; still, in most violent parts of country, no voting is likely to take place.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and AZAM AHMED
byline.contributor: Habib Zahori and Rod Nordland contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Amid repeated Taliban attacks and a continuing war, Afghan presidential candidates step onto planes with guards carrying AK-47s, and rocket-propelled grenades are sometimes part of carry-on baggage.

headline.main: War and Unrest Provide for a Scarred Campaign Trail in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: War and Unrest Provide for a Scarred Campaign Trail in Afghanistan
